item.title: Kim add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Kim add a quote by Martha Washington
item.description: "The greater part of our happiness or misery depends upon our dispositions, and not upon our circumstances." -- Martha Washington

item.title: Kim add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Do one thing every day that scares you." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Kim add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Kim add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Kim add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Another belief of mine: that everyone else my age is an adult, whereas I am merely in disguise." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Kim add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "The only way of discovering the limits of the possible is to venture a little way past them into the impossible." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Kim add a quote by Edith Sitwell
item.description: "Winter is the time for comfort, for good food and warmth, for the touch of a friendly hand and for a talk beside the fire: it is the time for home." -- Edith Sitwell

item.title: Kim add a quote by Zelda Fitzgerald
item.description: "She refused to be bored chiefly because she wasn't boring." -- Zelda Fitzgerald

item.title: Kim add a quote by Niels Bohr
item.description: "An expert is a person who has made all the mistakes that can be made in a very narrow field." -- Niels Bohr

item.title: Kim add a quote by Ezra Pound
item.description: "Man reading should be man intensely alive. The book should be a ball of light in one's hand." -- Ezra Pound

item.title: Kim add a quote by Jules Verne
item.description: "We are of opinion that instead of letting books grow moldy behind an iron grating, far from the vulgar gaze, it is better to let them wear out by being read." -- Jules Verne

item.title: Kim add a quote by Elizabeth Taylor
item.description: "The problem with people who have no vices is that generally you can be pretty sure they're going to have some pretty annoying virtues." -- Elizabeth Taylor

item.title: Kim add a quote by James Branch Cabell
item.description: "The optimist proclaims that we live in the best of all possible worlds; and the pessimist fears this is true." -- James Branch Cabell

item.title: Kim add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "I'm not young enough to know everything." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Kim add a quote by Peter Shaffer
item.description: "The trouble is if you don’t spend your life yourself, other people spend it for you." -- Peter Shaffer

item.title: Kim add a quote by Joseph Brodsky
item.description: "There are worse crimes than burning books. One of them is not reading them." -- Joseph Brodsky

item.title: Kim add a quote by Honoré de Balzac
item.description: "The more one judges, the less one loves." -- Honoré de Balzac

item.title: Kim add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "What she was finding also was how one book led to another, doors kept opening wherever she turned and the days weren't long enough for the reading she wanted to do." -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Kim add a quote by Robert Fulghum
item.description: "We’re all a little weird. And life is a little weird. And when we find someone whose weirdness is compatible with ours, we join up with them and fall into mutually satisfying weirdness—and call it love—true love." -- Robert Fulghum

item.title: Kim add a quote by Glen Cook
item.description: "Morning is wonderful. Its only drawback is that it comes at such an inconvenient time of day." -- Glen Cook

item.title: Kim add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "A man who procrastinates in his choosing will inevitably have his choice made for him by circumstance." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Kim add a quote by China Miéville
item.description: "A trap is only a trap if you don't know about it. If you know about it, it's a challenge." -- China Miéville

item.title: Kim add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies, said Jojen. The man who never reads lives only one." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Kim add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "I don't want to repeat my innocence. I want the pleasure of losing it again." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Kim add a quote by Tennessee Williams
item.description: "What is straight? A line can be straight, or a street, but the human heart, oh, no, it's curved like a road through mountains." -- Tennessee Williams

item.title: Kim add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view... Until you climb inside of his skin and walk around in it." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Kim add a quote by Diane Duane
item.description: "Reading one book is like eating one potato chip." -- Diane Duane

item.title: Kim add a quote by Desmond Tutu
item.description: "Do your little bit of good where you are; it's those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world." -- Desmond Tutu

item.title: Kim add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde
